results.title: Anne of Green Gables (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Kevin Sullivan, Ian McDougall and Sullivan Films
results.brief_description: Artistically filmed amidst the spectacular scenery of Prince Edward Island, Canada, this award winning movie follows the provocative life drama of Anne Shirley, an endearing orphan, from her struggles as an adolescent to her triumphs as a young woman. Based on the novel “Anne of Green Gables” by Lucy Maud Montgomery, it stars Megan Follows and Colleen Dewhurst.

results.title: The Seven year itch
results.creator_credit: Billy Wilder, Charles K. Feldman and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A husband of seven years, alone in New York while his family is on vacation, fantasises an affair with the TV model in the upstairs apartment and develops “The seven year itch”. Tortured by guilt, he envisions so many dire consequences that he finally runs off to join his wife. Tom Ewell and Marilyn Monroe star in this tremendous comedy. Based on the play by George Axelrod.

results.title: The Grass is singing
results.creator_credit: Michael Raeburn, Mark Forstater, Chibote Ltd and Svenska filminstitutet
results.brief_description: Set against the overwhelming African bush, Karen Black as Mary Turner plays a desperate woman searching for security and love. Unable to come to terms with herself or the land she lives in, Mary accepts a marriage proposal from farmer John Thaw, rather than remain single in a big city. But this is not the escape she hoped it to be. Based on the novel by Doris Lessing.

results.title: My Life as a Dog = Mit Liv Som Hund
results.creator_credit: Lasse Hallstrom, Waldemar Bergendahl, FilmTeknik and Svensk Filmindustri
results.brief_description: A film about growing up in Sweden in 1959 as seen through the eyes of Ingemar. Ingemar has to confront death, sex, soccer, girls, abandonment and guilt. Based on the autobiographical novel by Reider Jonsson.

results.title: Rembetika: The Blues of Greece
results.creator_credit: Philippe de Montignie, Zelda Rosenbaum, DNM Productions and Video Images Australia
results.brief_description: Narrated by Anthony Quinn, “Rembetika: The blues of Greece” is the story of the music made popular by the film, “Zorba the Greek”. This video was filmed in Greece, Turkey, America and Australia, and traces the history of this ‘blues’ music of Greece from its origins in the hashish dens of Athens and Smyrna. It includes rare footage of some of the most famous names in Rembetika such as, Mikis Theodorakis, Markos Vamvakaris, Sotiria Bellou, Mariza Koch and Vasilis Tsitsanis. There is even rarer footage of the 1921 invasion of Turkey, by Greece, which led to the greatest disaster in Greek history.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Philippe de Montignie, Zelda Rosenbaum, DNM Productions and Video Images Australia

results.title: Mrs. Soffel
results.creator_credit: Gillian Armstrong, Edgar J. Scherick, Scott Rudin and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A woman who distributes Bibles to prison inmates has an affair with one of them and later helps him to escape. Set in Pittsburgh at the turn of the century, starring Diane Keaton and Mel Gibson.

results.title: Introduction to Yoga
results.brief_description: In this video, especially made for beginners, Laliita Gilbert shows us: breathing, standing exercises, relaxation techniques. This highly instructive video introduces the viewer to the benefits of the essential philosophy and preparatory techniques of yoga.

results.title: Kismet
results.creator_credit: Vincente Minnelli, Arthur Freed and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Kismet is an enchanting musical filled with sensual dance and magical song. Howard Keel plays the witty poet-beggar whose quick tongue is forever getting him in trouble…and out again. Masquerading as Hajj, a famous sorcerer with magic powers, he has just the right amount of charm to turn a fair lady’s head, a fair lady who happens to be the Wazir’s Number One Wife! Cast also includes Ann Blyth, Dolores Grey, Vic Damone.

results.title: The Spiral Staircase
results.creator_credit: Robert Siodmak, Dore Schary and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: The spiral staircase is a thriller with chilling developments. It set a standard by which other classic thrillers may be judged. A small town in 1906 New England is terrorised by a psychopathic killer of deformed girls. Based on the novel “Some must watch” by Ethel Lina White. Stars Dorothy McGuire, George Brent, Kent Smith and Ethel Barrymore.

results.title: Indiscreet
results.brief_description: A NATO officer meets a beautiful actress and falls in love with her, but protects himself by saying he is married. The script of this film was written by Norman Krasna, based on his play “Kind Sir”. It stars Cary Grant and Ingrid Bergman.
